history.content: Students admitted at or after fall 2017 must take ee 16b. ee 16b is prerequisite for many ee courses as well as eecs 127

children.subject: I took 54 instead of 16A and then 16B the semester after. It went well. I wouldn't want to skip EE16B (and I don't think you can) if you want to do things involving applied linear algebra, unless you can pick up the skills somewhere else.

history.content:
For L&S CS, Math 54 can be used instead of either EE 16A or EE 16B. This seems useful for double majors as only the EECS department seems to accept EE16A/B as an equivalent to Math 54.
However, is it recommended to completely skip EE16A or EE16B after taking Math 54? If so, which one should I skip? Taking EE16A my second semester and using Math 54 credit to get out of EE16B seems like the simple solution to not struggle with circuits. Is EE16B a prerequisite to any upper division course for L&S CS majors?

Thanks!
history.subject: Which combination of Math 54, EE16A, and EE16B to take?
